Youth Explore Programs let students in grades 10 - 12 try out different trades so they can figure out which ones they like best. There are two different Youth Explore Programs available. 

Youth Explore Trades Skills

A great starting point for students in grades 10 - 12, this program is a way to explore multiple trades to discover the perfect fit—and pick up valuable skills in the process. The program is a partnership between the Ministry of Education and Child Care and SkilledTradesBC, designed to give students 120 hours of hands-on experience and a clear path before enrolling in a high school apprenticeship program. 

**Forms for Educators:**

[Youth Explore Programs Registration Form](/media/1763/download)

**Resources:**

[Youth Explore Skills Activity Plans](/youth-explore-trade-skills-activity-plans)

Youth Explore Trades Sampler

This is a chance for students in grades 10 - 12 to dive deep into a variety of trades as they find their preferred career path. Thanks to this partnership between the Ministry of Education and SkilledTradesBC, students gain 300 hours of hands-on experience before they enroll in a high school apprenticeship program like Youth Train in Trades or Youth Work in Trades.
